name: Ronom Hulk
text:
Protection from snow
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

name: Ronom Serpent
text:
Ronom Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls a snow land.
When you control no snow lands, sacrifice Ronom Serpent.

editions.flavor: With the spread of Rimewind's sorcerous winter, snow dwellers reclaimed their places atop the food chain.

name: Ronom Unicorn
text: Sacrifice Ronom Unicorn: Destroy target enchantment.

editions.flavor: The aberrant magic of the Rimewind drew the unicorns back from the northern wastes to do battle once again.

name: Roofstalker Wight
text: {1}{U}: Roofstalker Wight gains flying until end of turn.

editions.flavor: No heartbeat to hear, no greed to bribe, no fear of death.

name: Rooftop Storm
text: You may pay {0} rather than pay the mana cost for Zombie creature spells you cast.

editions.flavor:
"Let those idiot priests tremble! A new era in unlife begins here and now. Oglor, raise the lightning vane!"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Roon of the Hidden Realm
text:
Vigilance, trample
{2}, {T}: Exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: "Time and space are just new battlefields to be mastered."

name: Rootborn Defenses
text: Populate. Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn. (To populate, create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control. Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy creatures with indestructible.)

name: Rootbound Crag
text:
Rootbound Crag enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Forest.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

name: Rootbreaker Wurm
text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)

editions.flavor: As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.
As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.

name: Root Cage
text: Mercenaries don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

editions.flavor: The Vintara Forest welcomes its enemies with a crushing embrace.

name: Root Elemental
text:
Morph {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Root Elemental is turned face up, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Rootgrapple
text: Destroy target noncreature permanent. If you control a Treefolk, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"All the sylvan secrets of this world are etched between my rings. The skinfolk's metal aberrations can rot between my roots."
—Colfenor, the Last Yew

name: Root Greevil
text: {2}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Root Greevil: Destroy all enchantments of the color of your choice.

editions.flavor: The root of all greevils.

name: Rooting Kavu
text: When Rooting Kavu dies, you may exile it. If you do, shuffle all creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

name: Root-Kin Ally
text:
Convoke (Your creatures can help cast this spell. Each creature you tap while casting this spell pays for {1} or one mana of that creature's color.)
Tap two untapped creatures you control: Root-Kin Ally gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

name: Root Maze
text: Artifacts and lands enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Pause for the briefest of moments to consider the whorl of brambles, the tangled twist of bark, and the maze has already won.

"We should step up repairs. I think the forest has plans for us."
—Crovax

name: Root Out
text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")

name: Rootrunner
text:
{G}{G}, Sacrifice Rootrunner: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Roots
text:
Enchant creature without flying
When Roots enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor:
"That which nourishes can also bind."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

"That which nourishes can also bind."
—Gemma, Willow Priestess

name: Root Sliver
text:
Root Sliver can't be countered.
Sliver spells can't be countered by spells or abilities.

editions.flavor:
"It would take another apocalypse to stop the slivers now."
—Riptide Project researcher

name: Roots of All Evil
text: When you set this scheme in motion, create five 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.

editions.flavor: "I assure you, these are not the kind that thrive on sunlight and water."

name: Roots of Life
text:
As Roots of Life enters the battlefield, choose Island or Swamp.
Whenever a land of the chosen type an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

name: Root Spider
text: Whenever Root Spider blocks, it gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"They're not half as fierce if they don't see you coming."
—Devin, Faerie Noble

name: Rootwalla
text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

editions.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.
They make terrible pets . . . unless you don't like your other pets.

name: Rootwater Alligator
text: Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Rootwater Alligator.

editions.flavor: Subduing and skinning an alligator is the first rite of maturity adolescent merfolk must pass.

name: Rootwater Commando
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

editions.flavor: Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.
Rootwater merfolk are seldom seen these days, but elf corpses are as numerous as ever.

name: Rootwater Depths
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Rootwater Depths doesn't untap during your next untap step.

name: Rootwater Diver
text: {T}, Sacrifice Rootwater Diver: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"Drop a dagger into the murky deep and the merfolk will cut your throat with it."
—Skyshroud saying

name: Rootwater Hunter
text: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor:
"Bitter water, vicious wave;
Shadow-cold shallows, root-made maze.
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga

"Bitter water   vicious wave
Shadow-cold shallows   root-made maze
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Rootwater Matriarch
text: {T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as that creature is enchanted.

editions.flavor: In the harsh depths of Rootwater, the charms of surface dwellers are quite useless . . . except as lures.

name: Rootwater Mystic
text: {1}{U}: Look at the top card of target player's library.

editions.flavor:
"Read the roots    tell the tale
Future forms    in waving weeds
Higher than truth   is hope."
—Rootwater Saga

name: Rootwater Shaman
text: You may cast Aura cards with enchant creature as though they had flash.

editions.flavor:
"Ugh! When did orcs and fish start having kids?"
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

name: Rootwater Thief
text:
{U}: Rootwater Thief gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever Rootwater Thief deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, search that player's library for a card and exile it, then the player shuffles his or her library.

name: Rorix Bladewing
text: Flying, haste

editions.flavor: In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.
In an attempt to restore pride to Shiv and to forge an undying legacy, Rorix traveled far to compete for glory in Otaria's Grand Coliseum.
In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.
In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.

name: Rosheen Meanderer
text: {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}{C} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only on costs that contain {X}.

editions.flavor: Night after night, Rosheen babbled about a bygone sunlit world, her every word dismissed as a madwoman's ravings.

name: Rotcrown Ghoul
text: When Rotcrown Ghoul dies, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"Don't look into its eyes. It's thinking things no dead thing should think."
—Captain Eberhart

name: Roterothopter
text:
Flying
{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.

editions.flavor: "The Roterothopter is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in." —Baki, Wizard Attendant

"The roterothoper is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in."
—Baki, wizard attendant

name: Rot Farm Skeleton
text:
Rot Farm Skeleton can't block.
{2}{B}{G}, Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard: Return Rot Farm Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Rotfeaster Maggot
text: When Rotfeaster Maggot enters the battlefield, exile target creature card from a graveyard. You gain life equal to that card's toughness.

editions.flavor: Is it at the top of the food chain or the bottom?

name: Rotlung Reanimator
text: Whenever Rotlung Reanimator or another Cleric dies, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.

name: Rot Shambler
text: Whenever another creature you control dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Rot Shambler.

editions.flavor: "If I die, feed me to a shambler. At least that way I'll be doing some good."—Ryza, Oran-Rief scout

The hulk rose from the sea and loomed over the Champion. Pinned beneath the twisting, rotted planks of wood was the body of Kaliaros, the helmsman of her former crew, and beside him the captain, Photine.
—The Theriad
Vorinclex had no grand plan. The oil did its own work, evolving creatures into worthy predators.

name: Rotted Ones, Lay Siege
text: When you set this scheme in motion, for each opponent, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token that attacks that player each combat if able.

editions.flavor: "Don't come back until you've got brains in your teeth."

name: Rottenheart Ghoul
text: When Rottenheart Ghoul dies, target player discards a card.

editions.flavor:
"To die failing to save a loved one is just so sad—or, more to the point, pathetic."
—Liliana Vess
Its venom sacs are long gone, but its crushing strength is somehow greater than ever.

name: Rotting Giant
text: Whenever Rotting Giant attacks or blocks, sacrifice it unless you exile a card from your graveyard.

editions.flavor: Wracked with rot, it wrecks and ruins.

name: Rotting Legion
text: Rotting Legion enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Zombies have one speed: shamble.

Mastodons became extinct long ago, but foul forces of the Gurmag Swamp sometimes animate their decaying remains. The Sultai happily exploit such creatures but consider them inferior to their own necromantic creations.

name: Rotting Rats
text:
When Rotting Rats enters the battlefield, each player discards a card.
Unearth {1}{B} ({1}{B}: Return this card from your graveyard to the battlefield. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step or if it would leave the battlefield. Unearth only as a sorcery.)

name: Rot Wolf
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Rot Wolf this turn dies, you may draw a card.

name: Rough
text: Rough deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.

name: Roughshod Mentor
text: Green creatures you control have trample.

editions.flavor: He didn't hear the cries of the treefolk whose branches he snapped or of the elves caught underfoot. He had eyes only for the path ahead.

name: Rouse
text:
If you control a Swamp, you may pay 2 life rather than pay Rouse's mana cost.
Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

name: Rouse the Mob
text:
Strive — Rouse the Mob costs {2}{R} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.

name: Rousing of Souls
text: Parley — Each player reveals the top card of his or her library. For each nonland card revealed this way, you create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying. Then each player draws a card.

editions.flavor: "We remember. We rise."

name: Rout
text:
You may cast Rout as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

editions.flavor:
"End this. What I seek is far greater."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
One of the forest's best protectors is the forest itself.

name: Rowen
text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, holy avenger
Those who understand the forest are free to harvest its bounty.

"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."

Whenever a Swamp, Mountain, black permanent, or red permanent becomes tapped, Royal Decree deals 1 damage to that permanent's controller.

name: Royal Falcon
text: Flying

editions.flavor: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.
Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.

name: Royal Herbalist
text: {2}, Exile the top card of your library: You gain 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"It's not so easy anymore. Nothing grows in Kjeldor but seaweed."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran Priest

"Just as an Herbalist heals a wound, so must we heal the rift between Balduvia and Kjeldor."
—King Darien of Kjeldor

name: Royal Trooper
text: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:

—Sophocles, Phaedra

name: Rubble
text:
Aftermath (Cast this spell only from your graveyard. Then exile it.)
Up to three target lands don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

name: Rubbleback Rhino
text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: The trouble started when a street urchin bet a goblin he could ride one until the clock on Shilbo's Tower struck thirteen.

name: Rubblebelt Maaka
text: Bloodrush — {R}, Discard Rubblebelt Maaka: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The maaka remain loyal to us in this time of strife. We don't even have to feed them—our enemies do."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

"The maaka remain loyal to us in this time of strife. We don't even have to feed them—our enemies do."
—Nedja, Gruul shaman

text: Whenever Rubblebelt Raiders attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it for each attacking creature you control.

Rubblehulk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

text:
You may choose not to untap Rubinia Soulsinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as you control Rubinia and Rubinia remains tapped.

text:
First strike

"Its gems didn't stop pulsating until they were completely removed."

editions.flavor: Hobs bury their kin far from home. They believe the dry, open ground keeps hags from stealing the bones and gwyllions from stealing the spirits.

text:
First strike

name: Ruhan of the Fomori
text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, choose an opponent at random. Ruhan of the Fomori attacks that player this combat if able.

editions.flavor: Unfettered by allegiance, driven by war.

name: Ruination
text: Destroy all nonbasic lands.

"We have built a wall upon sand. The wall will vanish. The sand will remain."
—Oracle en-Vec

—Oracle en-Vec

name: Ruination Guide
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Ingest (Whenever this creature deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top card of his or her library.)
Other colorless creatures you control get +1/+0.

editions.flavor: When the architects of Ravnica claim a structure will stand against a wurm, they never mention for how long.

name: Ruin Ghost
text: {W}, {T}: Exile target land you control, then return it to the battlefield under your control.

editions.flavor: The Forsaken Ones haunt the ruins that flicker in and out of the spirit realm. Such sites are hard to find and even harder to loot.

name: Ruin in Their Wake
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
Search your library for a basic land card and reveal it. You may put that card onto the battlefield tapped if you control a land named Wastes. Otherwise, put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

name: Ruinous Gremlin
text: {2}{R}, Sacrifice Ruinous Gremlin: Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: City officials once sent twenty gleaming automatons to exterminate a nest of gremlins. They soon saw the error of their ways.

name: Ruinous Minotaur
text: Whenever Ruinous Minotaur deals damage to an opponent, sacrifice a land.

editions.flavor: Not every intelligent being is interested in treasure and lost knowledge . . . or even the basics of speech.

name: Ruinous Path
text:
Destroy target creature or planeswalker.
Awaken 4—{5}{B}{B} (If you cast this spell for {5}{B}{B}, also put four +1/+1 counters on target land you control and it becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste. It's still a land.)

name: Ruin Processor
text: When you cast Ruin Processor, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, you gain 5 life.

editions.flavor: The Eldrazi continue to sweep through the wastes, compounding destruction that already seemed absolute.

text:
Ruins of Oran-Rief enters the battlefield tapped.

text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

Appointed by the kha himself, members of the tribunal ensure all disputes are settled with the utmost fairness.

name: Rumbling Aftershocks

editions.flavor:
"I like it here. You always get a little more for your mana."

In the dim light beneath the vast trees of Deepglade, baloths prowl in search of prey. Their guttural calls are more felt than heard, but their attack scream carries for miles.

text:
